reviews.text: I stayed at this Courtyard for one night between Christmas and New Year's. I got a great rate and the room is exactly what I expected when booking with Courtyard - clean and well sized with courteous staff.
reviews.title: The Courtyard - Nice as Expected

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel because it was within walking distance of the High Museam of Art...took about 15 minutes to walk there.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel in Midtown Atlanta

reviews.text: I also was in town to visit the Aquarium, the Olympic Park and the CNN Center, etc...That area is about a 10 minute drive from this Courtyard if you know what you are doing. If you are unfamiliar with Atlanta and are visiting the Olympic Park/Aquarium area, you might want to stay in that area instead of at this hotel. Driving in the city is a bit confusing and what should have been a 10 minute drive from the hotel took me about 45 minutes.
reviews.title: Good value

likes.disliked: — not a lot of close by dinning options

reviews.text: But, the hotel was nice, as usual with Courtyard's by Marriott. It's a good value and the free parking is hard to beat. I plan to stay there again next year when I go back to the High.
reviews.title: Great deal
Wonderful
reviews.text: Stayed here while attending a class at GT November 13-16 2006. Super convenient to the campus and free parking (hard to find in Atlanta). Staff was freindly and greeted me everytime I entered the lobby. Hotel is in great shape, room was clean and comfortable. Breakfast buffet was good, a little pricey, but to be expected in metro area. Room was a little warm, air conditioning would only come on for a few minutes and then cut off. I did not complain, just opened the window for cool fresh air. I stayed in a room next to the interstate and could hear traffic noise, which didn't bother me too much. If this is a problem, request something away from the interstate.

reviews.title: Not what we expected
reviews.text: This hotel was really okay. The place was super clean, the staff was pleasant, and the pool was really great. We were surprised to find no hairdryer in our room as even low-end motels have those now, and it was even mentioned online. Seems like there would have been a microwave and mini-fridge, too, standard. Maybe we think too big. I dunno'. We were there for the Braves so we weren't too focused on the hotel. Go Braves!
We stayed at this Courtyard using a Marriott Rewards stay and chose this hotel because it was close to the end of the Peachtree Roadrace on July 4th.
reviews.title: Clean Hotel but Glad it Was Free
You get what you pay for
reviews.text: The hotel is very clean but quite frankly, I had concerns for our safety during our stay. During the evening, cars with dark windows were cruising the parking lot, groups of people were sitting in the parking lot in their cars, and other rowdy groups of people were getting into limos. This hotel is in a relatively isolated spot opposite the I-75/I-85 connector from Peachtree Street so it is out of the mainstream bustle of downtown. The hotel may be OK for businessmen (of which I am one) during the weekdays but I would think twice about bringing my family here.

reviews.title: Pretty but not enough air conditioning
reviews.text: The hotel staff is friendly and the rooms adequate but safety was our overwhelming concern staying at this hotel.

I agree with the previous post as far as the traffic situation goes. The construction is a nightmare and has the road all messed up. It seemed like the whole town was under construction though so it really didn't bother us that much.
reviews.title: Ok

likes.liked: — The parking was FREE, a hard find in downtown ATL
likes.disliked: — The wait for the computers, they should have applied a time limit.

reviews.text: The hotel was nice, had a strange smell to it when you first walked in the doors though, maybe it was just me. It seemed like every part of the hotel had been updated but for some reason they stopped at the bathrooms. We were on the 8th floor and everytime we took a shower the tub felt like we were going to fall through to the 7th floor. The water in the tub and sink wouldn't drain. The tub was extremely small. None of these were dealbreakers but taking a shower was uncomfortable.
reviews.title: Good, solid Courtyard Property

likes.disliked: — Torn up street adjacent to the hotel

reviews.text: BEWARE the walls are paper thin. If you are a light sleeper i would reccomend asking for a room on the end. We could hear the people in the room next to ours TV all night long.
reviews.title: Good business hotel
Bad
reviews.text: The staff was great, some seemed more knowledgeable than others about the surrounding area, the pool, whirlpool and fitness area seemed clean and well maintained.
We were unlucky in not having brought a computer and had to wait over an hour to use the ones in the lobby. They were excruciatingly slow and only one had flash player.
reviews.title: Good place to stay

reviews.text: This hotel was almost impossible to get to because of the 14th St. bridge being out. You need to go up State St. to 14th. The hotel was a bit run down. For example, the shower head was loose. The air conditioning did not have a thermostat. It was either on or off. It was hard to control the temperature. I had a King bed which was very comfortable, but there weren't any extra blankets that were easily available.
reviews.title: a bit rundown

reviews.text: The entire hotel was very clean and non-smoking. Yeah! Our room seemed to be newly refurbished. It didn’t even have any funky smells. The staff was notably friendly and helpful. The front desk workers greeted us almost every time we left or returned. The one time I missed the housekeeper, my fault, I was provided towels immediately upon request, and the employee even took out our trash. There were the usual amenities: iron, ironing board, and hairdryer. I really liked the single serve coffee maker. However, there was no microwave or fridge. There seemed to be room for one in the bathroom/kitchen area. Perhaps it had been removed to encourage use of the hotel restaurant/lounge. Breakfast was not free, but there was a very nice buffet. They offered eggs cooked to order.
reviews.title: A very good choice

reviews.text: The fitness area was clean with a variety of equipment. There is an outdoor pool, but it was too cold to use in February, and a hot tub. We used the hot tub once, the chlorine was so strong that it burned by eyes and bleached out my new swimsuit.
reviews.title: Good, clean convenient hotel

likes.liked: — Everything about it was above average
likes.disliked: — Road construction around hotel was inconvenient

reviews.text: The location has good and bad points. It is close to Atlantic Station shopping area, which has lots of shops, restaurants, a movie theater, Publix and a Target. The hotel offers a great complimentary shuttle service to and from anywhere in a two-mile radius. It is also close to Georgia Tech. The immediate area is mostly residential with nice looking townhouses and duplexes. The biggest drawback was the road construction, which is never ending in Atlanta. 14th street is completely demolished over interstate 85. This is supposed to be completed in June 09.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Be sure to eat at Vicory’s. It is a bit difficult to find, but definitely worth the effort. Copeland’s in Atlantic Station has unbelievable cheesecake.
reviews.title: Nothing fancy, but still nice
